title: TreVeyon Henderson explained why he looked at the sideline during key TD run
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: TreVeyon Henderson glanced at the sideline during a key touchdown run for guidance on whether to score or take time off the clock.
Henderson's fourth-quarter touchdown against the Buccaneers marked his first game surpassing 100 yards and scoring multiple touchdowns.
With Rhamondre Stevenson out, Henderson's role increased, helping the Patriots secure a win despite late pressure from Tampa Bay.

title: Mason Lohrei is latest Bruins player to respond from a Marco Sturm benching
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei had two assists in the Bruins' 5-3 win over Toronto after a five-game benching.
Lohrei was removed from the lineup due to defensive struggles, replaced by Jonathan Aspirot during Bruins' winning streak.
Boston's lineup adjustments under Marco Sturm have led to strong performances from players like Casey Mittelstadt and Johnny Beecher.

title: Petitioners gathering signatures to repeal legal marijuana accused of misleading voters
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Petitioners for a marijuana repeal are accused of misleading voters about the contents of their petition.
State officials received complaints about signature gatherers using false information to gain voter support for the petition.
Coalition for a Healthy Massachusetts denies supporting deceptive tactics and attributes allegations to the petition's early success.

title: Massachusetts state payroll hits $9B in 2025 â€” UMass system dominates
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts state payroll reached $9.19 billion in 2025, with a decrease from $10.26 billion in 2024.
UMass system employees made up all top 15 highest-paid state employees, led by Men's Basketball Coach Frank Martin.
UMass system accounted for $1.55 billion in payroll, followed by MBTA at $799.68 million and the Trial Court at $574.67 million.

title: Mass. State Police: 56 arrested in three-day child exploitation sweep
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts State Police arrested 56 people in a three-day operation targeting child exploitation and internet crimes.
Operation Firewall seized 229 electronic devices and executed 34 search warrants across the state.
Suspects ranged from 18 to 75, with charges including child pornography possession and attempting child enticement online.

title: 5 ways to help fight food insecurity in the North Shore right now
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Massachusetts' La Colaborativa and others are mobilizing food assistance amid a prolonged government shutdown affecting SNAP benefits.
Massachusetts has over one million SNAP recipients affected; 32% children, 31% disabled, 26% seniors.
Volunteer opportunities to fight food insecurity include Beverly Bootstraps, The Salem Pantry, and The Open Door in Gloucester.

title: SNAP fully funded, Healey says, as she urges residents to use benefits
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Gov. Maura Healey confirmed SNAP benefits in Massachusetts are fully funded, encouraging residents to utilize their benefits.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell helped secure a temporary block on the Trump administration's attempt to retract already issued SNAP benefits.
Congressional leaders are working on resolving the government shutdown, which may impact SNAP funding and health insurance tax credits.

title: Falmouth to vote on turning historic golf course into solar farm
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Falmouth residents will vote on November 17 to convert Cape Cod Country Club into a solar farm and conservation area.
The proposed solar farm will cover 57 acres with over 45,000 solar panels, generating 29,000 megawatt-hours annually.
The project includes donating 137 acres for conservation, with plans for walking trails and preserving local features.

title: Look inside Sheraton Boston’s whimsical new Goodnight Moon suite
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Sheraton Boston Hotel debuts a Goodnight Moon suite available until Feb. 28, 2026, after a $100 million renovation.
The suite recreates the story's Great Green Room with themed decor, a plush bunny, and a queen bed.
The package includes four tickets to View Boston and a $150 food and beverage credit in select hotel dining options.

title: 2 kilos of fentanyl recovered after investigation into Southwest Corridor drug activity, police say
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police recovered over two kilos of fentanyl in an investigation into drug activity in the Southwest Corridor.
Search warrants executed in Dorchester, Mattapan, and Roxbury led to five arrests and seizure of fentanyl, ammunition, and cash.
Arrestees include Ricky Wilson Soto-Arias and Doris Baez, both facing charges of Class A trafficking and unlawful possession.
